An Essentialist takes the time to explore all options. That extra effort pays off because some things are so much more important that they repay the effort tenfold. In short, an Essentialist figures out what matters more so they can do less. 

**Nonessentialist vs. Essentialist:**

- Thinks almost everything is essential.
- Views opportunities as basically equal.

**Essentialist:**

- Thinks almost everything is nonessential.
- Distinguishes the vital few from the trivial many.
